headline: Sweet Cornbread Cake
description: This sweet, moist cornbread is made with cornmeal, honey, eggs, melted butter, and whole milk; simply irresistible served hot from the oven.

video.description: See how to make sweet, cakey cornbread.
video.name: Sweet Cornbread Cake

name: Sweet Cornbread Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Stir flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt together in a mixing bowl. Pour in milk, beaten eggs, vegetable oil, melted butter, and honey; stir just to moisten.
Pour batter into the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this recipe just as it is. I have been using it for three years now and it is still a hit whatever the occasion. I love it!!!!
Baked at 5,300 ft above sea level. I decreased the sugar to 1 cup and increased temp to 360 F. Baked for 40 minutes. Came out super moist and golden light brown on top.
Sweet just like I like it. I make this recipe all the time. Love it!!

Delicious recipe, definitely corn cake and not corn bread. Some in my family think it is too sweet, so I have added half a cup of corn meal and decreased flour by half a cup. I also use all butter, omit the honey and decrease the sugar by 1/3 to 1/2. Still comes our sweet, but more cornbread flavor.
This is the best cornbread that I’ve ever made! I halve the recipe, used buttermilk and put the batter in cupcake pans! Yummy!
Amazing! 10/10 would definitely recommend this for anytime of day.

Thank you for this recipe, it's a lovely cake, rather a cross between a cake and cornbread. I added lemon zest and halved the recipe, using 50:50 cornmeal and apf. Can be made into muffins too. Love the taste, family loves it too! :-)
Absolutely the best cornbread on the planet. I did substitute buttermilk for the milk and it was still perfect, but I've made it as written and it's just exactly what I love in a cornbread

I served this as a side for a Cinco de Mayo dinner. With my husband's first bite of it, he exclaimed, "excellent", and everyone else enjoyed it. Quite moist and rises high in the middle. I made the recipe exactly as listed, and will make it the same way again. Why change a great thing!
Great. Cut back baking powder to 1 & half tablespoon instead of 2 tablespoon
Best cornbread ever! Made it with blue cornmeal. It seriously tasted like cake. So moist and yummy. Definitely keeping this recipe. Thanks for sharing!
I added 2 tbsp of sour cream… came out AMAZING
Overflowed my 9*13, but it was delicious. Might make it a little less sweet, but it was a hit.
My go too recipe for cornbread. Its a favorite among my circle of family/friends. I make as directed.

Very good. It was moist with a pleasant sweet aftertaste. I used 3 large eggs being as "eggs " normally means "medium ". I turned off oven at 45 minutes, opened oven door & left it in for an additional 10 minutes. It came out excellent. I also always use course ground cornmeal. Next time I'm going to pull a 1/4 cp of flour & add 1/4 cp more cornmeal.
 This will be my go-to recipe for cornbread...thank you, Allrecipes.
LOVE this recipe! It truly is no-fail. Rich, sweet with a delicate crumb. I did not have whole milk so I used what I had on hand: a pint of buttermilk and 1/2 cup 2%… Perfection.
This is a delicious snack cake or mealtime, but I would not substitute it for traditional cornbread. It made 12 muffing and a 10” round skillet.

Initially, when I saw this recipe I thought it was too sweet. I compared it to a recipe given to me by a family member and the ingredients were just about the same. I took out a 1/3 cup of sugar and substituted it was a tablespoon of honey. So 3 tablespoons of honey for my version. This is my 2nd time baking this cornbread and my family can't get enough of it. It is absolutely perfect!!
very good!! crowd pleaser!!

Wonderful….Just because, I added some nutmeg, coriander, small pieces of ham and thinly sliced spinach…..it turned out great…I did have to put a piece of foil over the dish because the top browned quickly before it was completely baked… I will make this again… forget the boxed muffin mix!
This was not good. I was embarrassed giving this out to family
My family adored this recipe. I separated it into two round pans though because my 9x13 was taken up with chicken still perfect.
This is the best recipe for people who love cornbread and those who don't. My whole family loves it. Thank you for sharing it.
What was the worst cornbread I've ever had. It was very light and fluffy but that is the only thing positive I can say for it. Had very little flavor, was not sweet, was incredibly disappointed.
I’m 60 and I’ve made a lot of cornbread in my time. This is a fabulous recipe! It’s moist and so tasty. Everyone always eats seconds and asks for the secret. Try it! You won’t regret it.
I love this recipe!! I’ve made it several times and get rave reviews every-time. The only thing I changed was cutting the recipe in half. This is the BEST on this site. Thank you for posting!

My family and I absolutely love this recipe just as it is. It is so delicious that even I ate some!!! That says a lot as I hate the taste of cornmeal, but this was sooo good!!! 
Thank you.
Great recipe

OMG! this was soo good. I actually cut down the sugar to only 1/3 and it was still Amazing. Paired some of it with homemade lemond curd from a recipe I found on this app and it has been heaven. definitely a keeper.
I only made half the recipe as it was too much. It turned out great!
This recipe is perfect.
Perfectly delicious
My husband and son loved it.

Loved it. The only things I changed was instead of oil, I used butter (melted) for a total of 1 cup . Layered cornbread with shredded sharp cheddar and diced jalapenos. I have been looking for a recipe just like this for years. Excellent recipe.
Excellent. When the corn bread cake came out of the oven, I spread softened butter across the top a couple of times. Next time I make it, I will sprinkle a little white sugar on top prior to baking.
I made this to go with chili. It's a very sweet cornbread with cake like consistency. Wonderful with honey and butter
It was very good! I cut down the sugar to 1 cup and it still tasted great!
Came out delicious. My family enjoyed it hot out the oven. I used 2% milk instead of whole milk.

Overall great recipe but it should specify to use fine grind cornmeal. I didn’t look and used medium grind. The cornbread came out textured which my hubby and toddlers actually really liked. I also used buttermilk and extra virgin olive oil. The rest I kept as the recipe.

This is a perfect recipe. I thought it would be sweeter based on other reviews. But it's not too sweet. Moist and just the right amount of sweetness. Perfect with butter and honey and you want it sweeter.
Easy to make. I added a can of drained corn. Came out great!
This turned out well. I made it for a potluck chili feed with friends. The only change I made was using 2 cups of flour and 1 cup of masa.

I didn't have regular corn meal, so I used 4 cups of corn flour and it came out great! Also, I don't have the patience to wait 45 minutes, so I used muffin top pans and they were ready in 12 minutes. So yummy, sweet and cakey, great with stewed apples! This is a huge recipe, it made 17 muffin tops and a dozen muffins, but they were all gone in a few hours!
I have made this cornbread so many times now, I can't even count! It is absolutely the best! Even some family members who hate cornbread, like this!
Really light and sweet cornbread. Big hit!
Delicious

I've made this recipe over and over it has never failed me. I claim to be a true Southern'er so I added some more honey to the recipe. I really added more honey, then more honey, and even more honey. I'd say maybe up to a 1/2 cup, the recipe will handle it. The batter won't be as thick, but will bake the same and taste even better. The photo is of a batch that I made in our RV 5-wheel camper, (Amarillo, TX). Came out fantastic as always

I have made this recipe twice.It was quick and easy, and most importantly-TASTY! My family devoured it. I used 1 c. Cornmeal and 1 c. Flour because I personally prefer that texture. This will be my go to recipe!

This is hands down the best Sweet Cornbread I have ever had. My whole family was oooohing and awwwwwing and yummmmmmying it all up! I put the recipe in my kitchen cookbook and there it will stay for my great grand children to get one day . As for now I'll cook it for my children and hubby every time they want cornbread with their meal. My father in-law is very hard to please when it comes to cornbread and when I made this for him he couldn't eat enough of it. LoL
We love this sweet cornbread with ham and bean--or any other meal! I made it from my phone recipe twice, then saved and printed so it's easy to access!
The family and I love this recipe! I do cut back on the sugar just a tad but other than that its amazing.

I used Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free 1 to 1 Baking flour and Califia unsweetened almond milk. I used a 9"x9" Pyrex dish and baked it an extra 15 minutes. It came out looking, smelling and tasting amazing! This cornbread is very sweet and cake-like.
Excellent, try making half recipe next time
Very moist and almost too sweet. I will probably cut back on the sugar next time I make this.
Excellent! I reduced the sugar by 1/4 cup and glad I did. Any more sugar would have made it too sweet for me.
used peanut oil for 1/3c when i ran out of other oil. it has a good texture.
This was great!!! So quick and easy ! Although we soak our cornmeal in milk for the day. It makes it so much better.
I used half and half, buttermilk, and whole milk. I added 1/2 teaspoon baking soda , and baked it in a bundt cake pan. We had the cake with fresh sliced peaches.

This cornbread is amazing, super moist and delicious!!!! I have made this several times with a few tweaks. I use coconut oil in place of vegetable oil. I used buttermilk in place of whole milk, and added fresh corn. omg. next time I will add some jalapenos for a nice kick. thank you for this recipe.

Just took this out of the oven and tried it. Easy recipe, however it is lacking something. Next time I’ll try adding extra honey or sugar. I’m surprised it was so bland with the amount sugar the recipe called for, but it definitely was lacking if you like your cornbread sweet.
Tastes like vegetable oil cake.

I’m giving five stars knowing that I altered the recipe quite a bit to make it lower calorie for my diet. I can only imagine how sweet/rich/delicious the original version is but I’m posting a modified low calorie version here for anyone looking to watch the waistline!

If you make this and call it corn bread you will get rave reviews. If you call it cake you will get rave reviews.. It was so good I ate most of the pan myself for desserts and breakfast with strawberry jam. Thank you!

OMG!!! Never again will I need to buy a box. I only have whole wheat flour around and was afraid it would be dry and flavorless. My family was surprised that it was so moist and yummy. This will definitely be made again.

This recipe produced cornbread exactly as promised. Sweet, thick, and moist. Since I was only cooking for four people, I cut the recipe in half and cooked it in a 9" x 9" square baker. It turned out perfect. Because it is thick, be patient. Wait for the top to crisp and crack. I've made this twice now, and the first time I took it out too early. The second time was perfect!!
It is a good recipe to try
Slapped some jalepenos on the top before pushing it into the oven and it was absolute deliciousness!

Great recipe. I only used 1 cup of sugar instead of 1 1/3. The recipe makes a big portion so I froze some and when I wanted cornbread, I took a few pieces out of the freezer, let them thaw in the fridge then reheated in the microwave and it was still good.
So much flour over-powered the corn taste, I think I need to add more cornmeal if I do this again. I Made this again and use 2.5 cups of Cornmeal and 1.5 cups of flour. WAY WAY Better...

I made this and cut the recipe in half. It is excellent!
I substituted buttermilk for the whole milk , added a 1/2 of baking soda. 
This has just the right amount of everything!
My son thinks he’s eating birthday cake.
Tried it, it was so moist because I added an extra egg
Very moist. Husband love d and he is not a cornbread lover..
Best cornbread recipe ever! I did use less sugar and used buttermilk.
I absolutely love this cornbread recipe. It's the perfect sweet to go beside a savory bowl of chili. I've made it at least a dozen times and it's perfect every time!
Fantastic recipe! I Will differently make it again.
Tastes like an actual cake. Didn't think it would. Now if I can only figure out what kind of frosting I'm going to put on it next time I make it.
Great cornbread recipe. I'll be using it again!
Best corn bread ever enjoyed every bite will definitely make this a keeper

It's snowing here so I had planned to make cornbread and chowder. We are almost out of milk so I got creative. I had a bunch of very ripe bananas so I used all the dry ingredients and mixed 2 cups water with 4 ripe bananas and a mixture of oil/melted butter to equal a cup. I didn't add the honey because the bananas made it sweet. It was supposed to be a breakfast bread in the morning, and luckily, there is still some left for tomorrow, because we had it for dessert. So moist. The point being that use what you have and adapt. Breads are versatile and breakfast breads are a treat.
Very moist and absolutely delicious
great recipe...It was devoured by family and friends! I used 3 parts cornmeal and 1 part flour bc I wanted to make sure it tasted like cornbread.

This recipe IS awesome! The ONLY changes I made was with the honey, and milk. I FORGOT to add the honey to the mixture, so I made honey butter instead, and brushed it over the hot cornbread as soon as it came out of the oven. I subbed b'milk instead of regular milk. The cornbread was so moist, and it baked up nice and soft. I also baked this in a 10 in cast iron skillet. I ate this with a basic chili recipe on a rainy, and cold day.. The few leftover slices we had? I nuked my portion of cornbread in the microwave for about 30 seconds...Mmmmm hmmmmm!!! Tasted like it was just made! I'm a southern girl, and this is not my usual way of making cornbread, NEVERTHELESS, it's a cornbread CAKE, and I really enjoyed this one, and so did my fiance... a nice change from the norm! This WILL be MY go to when I want to break tradition and do something different with my cornbread! Thanks for sharing! Peace and blessings!

This is a lovely moist cornbread! It is sweet and light. My friends loved it and want the recipe. I'm making it a second time to go with my chili. I did use 1 1/2 c. cornmeal and 2 1/2 c. flour. I used half brown sugar and half white sugar. I used buttermilk instead of regular milk, and I listened to the original submitter and added some baking soda. I have been searching for a cornbread that is moist and not dry like the recipe on the cornmeal box!
This one fits the bill!

I’ve never heard if cornbread “cake” before and I did not like it at all. The flour to corn meal ratio was off and I did not enjoy the cake like texture of it. Cornbread is supposed to be gritty/grainy the way cornmeal is, and this was fluffy and soft, more like cake. 
I give it 3 stars because it wasn’t bad for what it was, it’s just not cornbread. Now I understand the 1 star review that said it’s great for people who don’t like cornbread. I tossed it and made a simpler smaller recipe that turned out perfect. I’m just disappointed that I used the eggs and milk for this recipe and it didn’t turn out the way I wanted.

This cake was a hit in the house however not as sweet as I care for it to be. When I was mixing it was really soupy at first and then had major clumps so I took my immersion blender to it and felt better. Took a little longer than 45 minutes. This was a recipe that I would use again, just with a touch more sugar.
My entire family loved this cornbread.

I have been looking for the perfect recipe for cornbread that was sweet and moist and finally found it. The only change I made was to use 1% milk as that is what I had on hand. It didn’t seem to affect the result. The cake rose to the top of my 9 x 13 glass cooking dish and the taste and texture was just what I was looking for.
This cornbread is awesome! My family really enjoyed it. We’re keeping it!

I did this and only changes I made was I changed the ratio of flour to cornmeal from 3 to 1, to 2 to 2. I think it gives it more of a cornbread texture while still keeping the cake texture. It tastes wonderful very sweet, moist and tastes great with chili (or just by itself). This is the only cornbread we make anymore.
This cornbread takes me back to my Southern roots. So sweet and tender. I hate crumbly dry cornbread. This recipe is perfect.

This is a great recipe! Sweet, moist and less dense. Don’t get me wrong, I love a traditional, coarse cornbread baked in cast iron, but this was a nice twist. It works great with gluten free baking flour and vanilla almond or soy milk! G/f breads are usually too dense

I made this for thanksgiving. I added a half can of creamed corn, and although the recipe was very moist, it lacked a “corny” taste. Next time I will try roasting the cornmeal, as suggested in other reviews.
My family TORE THIS UP! It was the easiest cornbread I've ever made and it was soooooo fluffy and good!
This is a great recipe! Make it all the time! It's especially appreciated at Thanksgiving! Thanks for sharing!
I love this recipe. Its easy to make and has great flavor.
OMG this is amazing! corn bread is my fave. so moist and easy ro make. Took an extra 5 min to cook but love it.
My favorite recipe. It tastes like cake. You can eat it alone. Cut it large and there is enough for 12 people. SO easy. My 8yo daughter made it too.
A wonderful recipe for those that love sweet cornbread. I served this with a beanless chili and with the leftover cornbread (about 1/3 of the pan) I made a cornbread pudding. Delicious!
